verdict.summary: Calling a method on None — usually from an unhandled function return value or missing dictionary key.

dead_ends.why_fails: Masks the None source; bug surfaces elsewhere

dead_ends.action: Setting a default attribute on NoneType
dead_ends.why_fails: Cannot modify built-in types — raises TypeError: can't set attributes of built-in/extension type 'NoneType'. NoneType is immutable and does not support attribute assignment.

workarounds.action: Trace where the None comes from — add assertions or type hints
workarounds.how: assert value is not None, 'Expected non-None from function X'

workarounds.action: Use Optional type hints and None checks: if result is not None: result.split()
workarounds.how: Type checkers like mypy will flag unsafe None access
